roleset.name: to equip or provide
roleset.note: ARM-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of Vncls equip-13.4.2-1. (from arm.01-v)

example.name: passive
example.text: [*-1] Armed [*-2]with this shared understanding and requisite background information , [each department]*-2 developed its specialized contribution to the proposal , [*-1] submitting data and cost estimates on a closely managed schedule .
example.arg: with this shared understanding and requisite background information

example.name: transitive with purpose
example.text: Thus [*-3] armed [*-2]for massive matching of documents by computer , [they]*-2 single out high-income groups , [*-3] looking primarily for people who [*T*-1] have n't filed New York income-tax returns .
example.arg: for massive matching of documents by computer

roleset.name: arm_up
roleset.note: ARM_UP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Comparison to arm.01. (from arm.02-v)

example.name: ergative
example.text: I support Saudis arming up though , as I do for all Muslim nations , weapons may be useful in future .

roleset.name: deflect an opponent using straight, stiff arms (maybe metaphorical)

example.name: stiff_arm-v
example.text: If Megawati does stiff - arm the United States on the weapons issue , it is unlikely relations with Washington will be permanently damaged .
